Powell has been saying for months that the path of interest rates is going to be "data dependent." Dovish???

"The donkey said to the tiger:

"True, the grass is blue."

The donkey hurried and continued:
"The tiger disagrees with me and contradicts and annoys me, please punish him."

The king then declared:

The donkey jumped cheerfully and went on his way, content and repeating:
"The grass is blue!"

The tiger accepted his punishment, but he asked the lion:
"Your Majesty, why have you punished me? After all, the grass is green."

The lion replied:
"In fact, the grass is green."

Mail in ballots were originally intended for military persons. It was during the Civil War that America first experimented with absentee voting on a large scale, as so many of the men who were eligible to vote were away from home fighting. 
President Lincoln wanted to assure that he got the votes of the soldiers who were serving away from home. Aside from that, up until the late 1970's, those who voted by mail generally had to have a specific reason (like sicknesses) for not being able to vote in person on Election Day.  That began to change in 1978, when California became the first state to allow voters to apply for an absentee ballot without having to provide an excuse. 
I find it statistically strange that there is such a huge proportional difference between the two parties; literally inverse (see chart below). I am not implying the the 2020 election was rigged or stolen. But I also think it is very naive to think that if a loophole to cheat was available, either party wouldn't cease the opportunity. There's cheating in sports, business and pretty much everything. The US Presidency is the most powerful position on planet earth. Politics is the hardest hitting competition on earth. We should assume that both sides will cheat if given the opportunity. And that's why we should close all avenues as best we can to mitigate the cheating and its statistical significance. 
There's a very easy way to ensure a fair election. GO BACK TO BASICS! 
US citizens must show up with a valid ID in person, or be a military person unable to vote due to their duties. Exceptions could also be made for extreme circumstances like serious illness. Computers can be hacked. This is a case where keeping it simple is the best solution.

A study was done on 77,000 accounts at a large discount broker from 1990 to 1996. The findings revealed:

1. Investors are more likely to allow a stock to reach a large loss than they are to allow a stock to attain a large gain; they hold losers too long and sell winners too quickly.

2. The probability of buying additional shares is greater for shares that have lost value than it is for shares that have gained value. Investors may readily double down their bets when stocks decline in value.

3. Investors are more likely to take a small gain than a small loss.

The results would be no different 50 years ago, or 50 years from now.
name: Mark Minervini

Go boldly after what you want and expect some setbacks, some disappointments, and some rotten days. Embrace them all as a valuable part of the process and learn to say, “Thank you, teacher.”
